document.heading: Information Technology Apprenticeship Amendment Act of 2000

history.narrative: Law 13-257, the “Information Technology Apprenticeship Amendment Act of 2000”, was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-760, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 8, 2000, and December 5, 2000, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 22, 2000, it was assigned Act No. 13-544 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-257 became effective on April 3, 2001.

meta.search-text: ENROLLED ORIGINAL 1 AN ACT IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA To amend the Amendments to An Act To Provide For Voluntary Apprenticeship in the District of Columbia Act of 1978 to require all contractors who contract with the District of Columbia government to perform work in the area of information technology to register apprenticeship programs with the District of Columbia Apprenticeship Council. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "Information Technology Apprenticeship Amendment Act of 2000 Sec. 2. Section 5 of the Amendments to An Act To Provide For Voluntary Apprenticeship in the District of Columbia Act of 1978 is amended as follows a) The existing text is designated as subsection (a b) New subsections (b) and (c) are added to read as follows b) Ninety (90) days after the effective date of the Information Technology Apprenticeship Amendment Act of 2000, all contractors who contract with the District of Columbia government to perform information technology work with a single contract or cumulative contracts of at least $500,000, let within a twelve (12) month period shall be required to register an apprenticeship program with the District of Columbia Apprenticeship Council c) For purposes of this section, the term "Information technology work" shall include the occupations of computer programmer, programmer analyst, desktop specialist, technical support specialist, data base specialist, network support specialist, and any other related occupations as the District of Columbia Apprenticeship Council may designate by regulation Sec. 3. Fiscal impact statement. The fiscal impact statement is attached. Sec. 4.
